attributes.action: Give people aged 16 and 17 a vote in local & national elections and referenda.
attributes.additional_details: During the 2014 Scottish independence referendum sixteen and seventeen year olds were given the vote and proved to be as enlightened and responsible as everyone else.
attributes.background: 1.5 million people in the UK are denied a political voice. This encourages political disaffection. At sixteen they can join the armed forces, get a job, pay tax, obtain tax credits, marry, enter a civil partnership or become a parent. They understand issues but can't shape laws that govern them.
